page.title: 06Our Local Festivals
page.content: PENKHULL - In the 1930's the Reverend Aston of St.Thomas Church decided to have a concert to raise money for church funds.He wrote and directed it and his wife trained the children.The tradition continued for many years and today the local music festival,known as the Penkhull Festival includes local talent and famous names. The popular annual pantomime was started in 1957 and is held in Penkhull Methodist Church. The Penkhull Puffer is a new event.It is a "fun run" in two sections,a two mile and a five mile race,to raise money for charity. HARTSHILL - The Hartshill festival is held annually.It is a week-long event of various entertainments,including sports- indoor and out,road races,music and inter-pub competitions.
